html:
By Mumbai Newsroom
NewsRise
MUMBAI (May 18) -- Decline in Bharti Airtel’s average revenue per user disappointing, especially considering improving subscriber mix, Jefferies says. Bharti's 4Q ARPU down 13% on-quarter to INR145 and down 1% excluding impact of Interconnect Usage Charges, house notes. “We find this surprising considering Bharti's improving subscriber mix and front-ended subscriber additions in 4Q,” house says. Lowers ARPU estimates by 4-5% to factor 4Q miss. Cuts India mobile estimates, but raises consolidated estimates by 1-3% to factor in increase in Home broadband, Airtel Business and Airtel Africa segments. Increases subscriber forecasts by 4% after 4Q positive surprise of 13.4 million subscriber additions and expects 13% CAGR in revenues and 18% CAGR in EBITDA. Still, maintains Hold rating and INR590 target price, citing limited upside triggers. Shares down 1.5% at INR541.30.
- By Mumbai Newsroom; editorial@newsrise.org ;+91-22-6135 3300
